definitions.body: odorif. tree, aloe (?) (? loan-word from Skr. aguru, agaru, dial. aghil, cf. Wilson:Skr. Dict.; M. Müller in Pusey:Da 2 ed. p. 647 f; aloëxylon agallochum (cf. Sigismund:Aromata, Leipz. 1884, p. 38 f, MV cite Kondracki:Beltr. z. Kenntn. d. Aloe, Dorpat 1874 & Baer:Reden III, 293 f); others aloë succotrina (Schenkel:BL, cf. Di ad Nu 24:6); Wetzst in De:Ct 2d ed. 167 brings under I. [[אהל]]; he proposes cardamum, Ar. hayl fr. 0uhayl = little tents, from three-cornered shape of capsules)
pl. [[אֲהָלִים]] trees planted by ´[[י]] Nu 24:6 (‖[[ארזים]] perh. error for [[אֵילִים]] cf. Di.

aloes, as sweet-smelling; perfume for bed, [[אֲהָלִים]] Pr 7:17 (‖[[מׂר]], [[קִנׇּמוֹן]]); for garments [[אֲהָלוֹת]] Ps 45:9 (‖[[מׂר]], [[קְחִיעוֹת]]); of bride, under fig. of odorif. tree Ct So 4:14 (‖[[מׂר]], [[כָּל־רָאשֵׁי בְשָׂמִים]]).
